snippet: The group has warned school districts and charter school chains that the size of its corps of teachers this fall could be down by as much as a quarter.
abstract: Number of college graduates applying to Teach for America program has fallen for second year in a row, with applications down by 10 percent compared to same period in 2014; organization points to rebounding economy with more job offers for graduates as one reason for decline; critics say program's short training time, ties to education standards movement and political connections may be driving applicants away.
lead_paragraph: The group has warned school districts and charter school chains that the size of its corps of teachers this fall could be down by as much as a quarter.

headline.main: Fewer Top Graduates Want to Join Teach for America
headline.print_headline: Fewer Top Graduates Want to Join Corps of Temporary Teachers
